author: potuz
content: Continuing here: implemented the hashing algo in assembly, nothing really fancy, but optimized for fixed size 64bytes blocks (hard-coding the padding block) and I get 190ms vs fastssz's 290, now I'm crushing prysm. Will now move to optimize for my cpu to see how far one can go, but clearly openssl is too generic: any implementation of sha256 that is prepared to hash long buffers gets crushed compared to one made for Merkle trees: this is my take on this experiment.
